elements.title: Schoenoplectus triqueter (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Schoenoplectus triqueter (pictured) can grow up to 1.5 metres (4 ft 11 in) tall on stems less than half a centimetre (0.20 in) wide?

elements.title: Songbird (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in her musical show Songbird, Regine Velasquez performs one lesser-known song from the featured theme each week?

elements.title: Kiribati at the 2020 Summer Olympics (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a high jumper took up sprinting to qualify for Kiribati at the 2020 Summer Olympics?

elements.title: Vivian Cosby (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that playwright Vivian Cosby was hospitalized for three and a half years after lighting herself on fire because of a faulty gas heater?

elements.title: place of outstanding historical and cultural influence (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Creamoata Mill, which once produced a now-nonexistent breakfast food, was listed as Gore's only "place of outstanding historical and cultural influence"?

elements.title: I Am Human (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the documentary film I Am Human has been the conversation starter for neuroscience panel discussions at universities such as Harvard?

elements.title: Gabriel André Aucler (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Gabriel André Aucler tried to reestablish paganism after the French Revolution?

elements.title: Alan Kulwicki Memorial Park (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Alan Kulwicki Memorial Park was partially financed with a US$250,000 donation from Hooters chairman Robert Brooks?
